string-array.name: ingredients_array
string-array.item: %1$d Gramm of wheat flour (Type 405)
%1$d eggs
%1$d ml of milk
%1$d ml mineral water preferably sparkling
%1$d pinch of salt
%1$d tablespoon of sunflower oil

string-array.name: preparation_array
string-array.item: At first, I prepare myself all the ingredients. With a pan of this size I can bake 5-6 pieces
I stir the eggs lightly until a homogeneous dough is formed
I stir the dough carefully (at low speed) further
Now I carefully and slowly fill the milk and the sparkling mineral water into it
Then I add the sifted carefully wheat flour and continue stirring. The sifting will dissolve the first clumps in the flour
Lastly I put in the sunflower oil und the pinch of salt under stirring
I now stir the dough well again for 5–7 minutes
Now I let the dough rest for 10–20 min.
Meanwhile, I can heat the pan with a very small amount of oil or lard. Attention not too hot! On our electric stove I got good results at level 7 of 10
With a ladle or something else suitable, I put quite quickly so much batter in the pan that the layer is thin (here it is a matter of trying out)
I wait until the visible side dries, then I turn the pancake
If the underside that is now on top is not brown enough for me, I turn a second time later
I take the pancake out of the pan and can top or sprinkle.
When it comes to toppings, everything is possible and everything is allowed, from tuna to ham or cinnamon and sugar, I can recommend anything. But I like best Apricot jam.
